intro: Tabernaemontana fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are predominantly white or pale yellow. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
